abstract: Lawyers for Dylann Roof, who is accused of killing nine black members of a Charleston, SC, church  in 2015, file motion challenging constitutionality of death penalty; challenge comes after federal prosecutors reject guilty pleas in exchange for multiple life sentences with no chance of parole.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for the white man accused of killing nine people in a historic African-American church in Charleston, S.C., last year argued that capital punishment is unconstitutional.
snippet: Lawyers for the white man accused of killing nine people in a historic African-American church in Charleston, S.C., last year argued that capital punishment is unconstitutional....

headline.main: Dylann Roof’s Lawyers Argue Against Death Penalty
headline.print_headline: Lawyers for Suspect in Charleston Church Killings Challenge Death Penalty
